chapters.title: The Last Petal Falls
chapters.summary: Structured, ambitious event planner Elara inherits her beloved aunt's historic coastal inn, only to discover a shocking marital clause in the will. Meanwhile, she clashes with Kai, the charming but frustratingly relaxed surf instructor next door.
key_events: Elara's meticulous planning of her aunt's memorial service is disrupted by Kai's loud reggae music.
The reading of the will reveals Elara inherits The Mariposa Inn, her childhood sanctuary.
The catch: a 'matrimony mandate' requiring her to be married within one year to claim it.
Elara learns the inn is deeply in debt and needs major repairs.
She overhears Kai at the local coffee shop, desperate for a loan to save his surf school from a corporate buyout.
chapters.ending_hook: Staring at the will and listening to Kai's woes, a desperate, insane idea begins to form in Elara's mind.

chapters.title: Terms of Surrender
chapters.summary: Elara proposes a marriage of convenience to Kai: her inheritance for his capital. They negotiate a detailed, emotionless contract to govern their arrangement.
key_events: Elara awkwardly pitches the business proposal to a stunned Kai.
Kai is initially insulted, then intrigued by the financial lifeline.
They draft a 'Prenup Clause' addendum: separate lives, no romance, annulment after one year.
Specific rules include: his messy surf gear stays in the garage, her spreadsheets don't govern his life.
They agree to a small, quiet courthouse wedding to satisfy the will's executor.
chapters.ending_hook: Shaking hands on the deal, both feel a surprising jolt of electricity—which they promptly attribute to static shock.

chapters.title: I Now Pronounce You Stressed
chapters.summary: Elara and Kai have their quick, legal wedding, but the pressure to appear authentic begins immediately from a suspicious local.
key_events: The awkward, minimalist courthouse ceremony with two strangers as witnesses.
Kai lightens the mood with a silly, improvised vow about sharing sunscreen.
They're spotted leaving by Margo, the town's gossipy boutique owner.
Over dinner, they practice their 'how we met' story, arguing over the details.
Elara moves her things into the inn, strictly to the master suite; Kai takes the renovated loft apartment.
chapters.ending_hook: Lying alone in the giant bed, Elara hears Kai laughing on a late phone call downstairs, and feels an unexpected pang of loneliness.

chapters.title: The Inn-cubator
chapters.summary: Forced to cohabitate to maintain appearances, Elara and Kai's opposing lifestyles clash hilariously as they host their first 'couple's' event at the inn.
key_events: Elara's 5 AM alarm vs. Kai's sunrise surf session.
They host a book club for town matriarchs to seed their 'love story.'
Kai charms the guests with effortless stories, accidentally undermining Elara's carefully crafted narrative.
A plumbing disaster in the main hall forces them to work together, revealing Kai is surprisingly handy.
They share a tired, triumphant beer after the guests leave, a moment of genuine camaraderie.
chapters.ending_hook: Margo comments on how 'convenient' their marriage seems, putting them both on high alert.

chapters.title: The Rival Reformation
chapters.summary: Kai helps Elara with a high-stakes wedding at the inn, showing a competent side that challenges her perception of him.
key_events: A demanding bride threatens to ruin the inn's reputation.
Kai calms a vendor crisis using his local connections and easy charm.
Elara sees him patiently teaching a nervous child to surf, softening her view of him.
He surprises her with a perfectly executed logistical move during the reception.
They dance together briefly to maintain the ruse, and the physical contact is unsettlingly pleasant.
chapters.ending_hook: The bride compliments their 'real love,' leaving both Elara and Kai flustered and silent on the drive home.

chapters.title: Contract Breaches
chapters.summary: A visit from the will's executor forces Elara and Kai to perform coupledom, leading to a fake date that feels too real.
key_events: The executor, a stern lawyer, announces a surprise 'wellness check' on the marriage.
They stage a romantic beach picnic, full of forced affection.
While arguing over the performance, they accidentally reveal personal fears—her fear of failure, his fear of being tied down.
Kai teaches Elara to surf, a patient and touching moment that ends with her laughing in his arms.
They share a kiss for the executor's benefit, which leaves them both breathless and confused.
chapters.ending_hook: That night, Elara finds Kai's forgotten hoodie and, against her better judgment, puts it on.

chapters.title: Town Hall and Turmoil
chapters.summary: The town's skepticism peaks at a summer festival, forcing a grand romantic gesture that blurs all lines.
key_events: Rumors about their arrangement are swirling; the inn's credibility is at stake.
During a town dance, they must enter the couple's contest.
While dancing, they forget the audience, lost in the moment and each other.
Kai spontaneously dips Elara, followed by a kiss that is definitely not for show.
They win the contest, but the victory feels hollow as they retreat to separate corners, terrified.
chapters.ending_hook: Kai suggests they need to 'reaffirm the contract,' but his voice lacks conviction.

chapters.title: The Midnight Amendment
chapters.summary: A massive storm hits the coast, trapping them together in the inn and forcing emotional confessions.
key_events: They work side-by-side to batten down the inn and secure Kai's surf school.
Sharing blankets by the fireplace during a power outage, the atmosphere is intimate.
They play 'never have I ever,' revealing vulnerabilities and past heartbreaks.
Elara admits why she's so afraid to rely on anyone; Kai confesses his dream isn't just the school, but building a real community.
They fall asleep on opposite ends of the couch, but wake up tangled together.
chapters.ending_hook: In the calm morning after, they silently agree not to talk about the night, but the distance between them is gone.

chapters.title: The Love Audit
chapters.summary: With the one-year deadline approaching, the executor returns for a final review. Elara and Kai must decide if they will confess their feelings or stick to the original plan.
key_events: The lawyer interviews them separately, asking pointed questions about love and future plans.
Realizing their answers are alarmingly congruent and heartfelt.
Kai receives a firm buyout offer for his business, the original goal of their deal.
Panicked, Elara suggests they should just take the annulment and get what they wanted.
Kai agrees, but both are visibly devastated.
chapters.ending_hook: They sign the annulment papers, the pen feeling like lead in their hands.

chapters.title: The Unbinding
chapters.summary: In the final week before the deadline, they try to live as separate people in the same house, but the pretense is agony.
key_events: Painfully polite interactions and rigid adherence to the 'roommate' rules.
Elara throws herself into inn repairs; Kai spends all day at the beach.
Elara finds the silly 'sunscreen vow' note from their wedding day in her planner.
Kai turns down the buyout offer, realizing the money means nothing without her.
They both show up at the same cliffside at sunset, a place they'd once joked about.
chapters.ending_hook: Standing feet apart, both start to speak at the same time: 'We need to talk about the contract...'

chapters.title: Clause of the Heart
chapters.summary: Elara and Kai finally confess their love, but face a new obstacle: the legal and financial tangle they've created.
key_events: Their emotional confession is interrupted by Margo, who reveals she knew all along and was rooting for them.
The town, having seen their real love bloom, rallies behind them.
The executor arrives for the final decision. They confess the marriage started as a contract, but is now real.
Using a clause about 'good faith,' the lawyer argues their emotional evolution fulfills the aunt's true wish: for Elara to find a real partner to share the inn with.
The inheritance is approved, but their personal future is still unwritten.
chapters.ending_hook: Kai asks, 'So, what does our new contract look like?'

chapters.title: The Forever Amendment
chapters.summary: One year later, Elara and Kai host a grand reopening of the fully restored inn, celebrating their very real love story.
key_events: The Mariposa Inn is thriving, combining Elara's organization with Kai's community spirit.
Kai's surf school is now part of the inn's offerings.
They host a party for the whole town, their original 'witnesses' in attendance.
Margo gives a toast that roasts and honors them in equal measure.
Under the same arch where they had their fake wedding, Kai gets down on one knee—not with a new contract, but with a ring, asking for a real, forever vow.
chapters.ending_hook: As Elara says 'yes,' the sun sets over the coast, illuminating the clause they wrote on each other's hearts: love, partnership, and a happily ever after, no fine print needed.
